clinical_study.brief_title: the Prevalence of "Wearing-off" in Patients With Parkinson's Disease in Shanghai
clinical_study.official_title: the Prevalence of "Wearing-off" in Patients With Parkinson's Disease in Shanghai, China: a Cross-sectional Investigation

lead_sponsor.agency: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The study would be designed as a multi-center cross-sectional investigation on the prevalence of Wearing-off in Parkinson's patients in Shanghai as well as related influencing factors.

detailed_description.textblock: PD patients would be randomly recruited into this investigation from around thirty hospital covering the 16 districts of Shanghai. The wearing off would be defined by two methods: the doctors' judgement or the WOQ-9 questionnaire which was a patient-determining tool. The investigation also includes the medicine, the severity of PD symptoms, the demographic factors. The study would be designed with the purpose of clarifying the prevalence of the "wearing-off" and its related influencing factors.

primary_outcome.measure: the prevalence of wearing off effect in Parkinson's patients that received stable anti Parkinsonian therapy in Shanghai of China
primary_outcome.description: every participant receives a clinical assessment of the wearing-off symptoms by a physician and completes a self rating scale of the wearing-off 9 questionnaire (WOQ-9) to obtain a prevalence of wearing-off positive individuals( wearing-off would be diagnosed by physicians during the clinical assessments)

secondary_outcome.measure: the sensitivity and the specificity of the wearing-off 9 questionnaire in the diagnosis of wearing-off effect in Parkinson's disease.
secondary_outcome.description: The physician assessment served as the standard for comparison with the WOQ-9 questionnaire. Sensitivity was defined as the probability that a PD patient, classified as having wearing-off (WO) according to physician assessment, would be classified as having the WO using the WOQ-9 questionnaire. The specificity was defined as the probability that a PD patient without the WO by physician assessments would be classified as being without the WO using the WOQ-9 questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: the risk factors of wearing-off in Parkinson disease
secondary_outcome.description: assess patients clinical characteristics and medical treatments, including the onset age, disease duration and daily levodopa dosage in the subsets of Parkinson patients with wearing-off diagnosed by physician assessment.

arm_group.description: people who have been clinically diagnosed with Parkinson's disease (PD) and have received anti PD therapy would be recruited into the study. The anti -PD treatment would not be changed in the population of the participants. We would use the tool of 'Wearing-off 9 questionnaire' to determine the prevalence of Wearing-off phenomenon in Parkinson's patients in Shanghai

intervention.description: The participants would receive appropriate anti-PD medical treatments according to the patients' need during the investigation.The anti -PD treatment would not be changed in the population of the participants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- have been clinical diagnosed with Parkinson's disease
- have received stable anti-Parkinson's treatment before being recruited to the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- being suspicious of atypical Parkinson syndrome or secondary Parkinson syndromes
- have not received anti Parkinsonian treatment.
- being combined with serious cognitive dysfunction or psychiatric symptoms
- unable to complete the investigations.
